definition: unwilling to remain lonely or idle/unwilling to be left out
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
silent/solitary/Taiwan pr. [ji2]
lonesome

sentences.english: Once their public articles meant little for the worldliness, they would be happy to write novels.
sentences.chinese: 经济文章，无补于世，也会不甘寂寞，去著小说。

sentences.english: Instead of remaining silent, a new generation of authors has found its voice on the web.
sentences.chinese: 新一代作家纷纷不甘寂寞，在网络上发出自己的声音。

sentences.english: The news media even gets involved.
sentences.chinese: 甚至新闻媒体也不甘寂寞。

sentences.english: The night sky was unwilling to remain out of the limelight, the crescent moon.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临，天空露出不甘寂寞的月牙。

sentences.english: He is not a very quiet man and always wants to be to the fore.
sentences.chinese: 他是个不甘寂寞的人，常想招人注目。

definition: restless/unsettled
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
content with one's lot/knowing one's place
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to loiter/to hang around/dissolute/licentious
(idiom) not want to be outdone/not content to lag behind
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
to carry on intimately with (idiom); ardent relationship (esp. between lovers)/billing and cooing
to be willing to/to be ready to/to be content with/accepting (of restriction, sacrifice, risk etc)
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
willingly
to make up and go on stage (idiom); to embark on a career (esp. in politics or crime)
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
